\section{Generation of MATH: Intermediate Algebra}
\label{sec:generation-MATH-Intermediate-Algebra}

\begin{longtable}{|l|p{8cm}|p{8cm}|}
\caption{New questions generated from Intermediate Algebra questions in the MATH dataset, and the closest question among the existing questions.}\\
\hline
\textbf{ID} & \textbf{Auto-Generated question} & \textbf{Closest question in the dataset}\\
\hline
1 & Let $f(x)$ be a cubic polynomial such that $f(0)   1$ and $f(1)   2.$ Find the value of $f(2).$& 
Find all positive real numbers $x$ that satisfy \[x \sqrt{12 - x} + \sqrt{12x - x^3} \ge 12.\]Enter all solutions, separated by commas.
\\
\hline
2 & Let $f(x)$ be a cubic polynomial such that $f(0)   0$ and $f(1)   1.$ Find all possible values of $f(0.5).$& 
Find all positive real numbers $x$ that satisfy \[x \sqrt{12 - x} + \sqrt{12x - x^3} \ge 12.\]Enter all solutions, separated by commas.
\\
\hline
3 & Let $x$ and $y$ be positive real numbers such that $x^2 + y^2   1.$ Find the maximum value of $xy.$&
Given that $x^2 + y^2   14x + 6y + 6,$ find the largest possible value of $3x + 4y.$
\\
\hline
4 & Let $f(x)   x^2 + ax + b$ be a polynomial with real coefficients such that $f(1)   1$ and $f(2)   4$. Find $f(3).$& 
Let $r$ and $s$ denote the two real roots of $x^2 - x \sqrt{5} + 1   0.$ Then determine $r^8 + s^8.$
\\ 
\hline
5 & Let $f(x)   x^2 + ax + b$ be a polynomial with real coefficients such that $f(0)   0$ and $f(1)   1.$ Find the value of $a^2 + b^2.$& 
Let $r$ and $s$ denote the two real roots of $x^2 - x \sqrt{5} + 1   0.$ Then determine $r^8 + s^8.$
\\
\hline
6 & Let $f(x)   x^2 - x - 1$ and $g(x)   x^2 - x + 1.$ Find the sum of the two roots of $f$ and the sum of the two roots of $g$.&
Let $r$ and $s$ denote the two real roots of $x^2 - x \sqrt{5} + 1   0.$ Then determine $r^8 + s^8.$
\\
\hline
7 & Let $x$ and $y$ be positive real numbers such that $x^2 + y^2   1.$ Find the maximum value of $x^2y^2.$& 
Given that $x^2 + y^2   14x + 6y + 6,$ find the largest possible value of $3x + 4y.$
\\
\hline
8 & Let $f(x)   x^2 - x - 1$ and $g(x)   x^2 + x - 1$ be two polynomials with real coefficients. Let $h(x)   f(x)g(x) - g(x)f(x).$ Find the degree of $h.$ & 
Let $r$ and $s$ denote the two real roots of $x^2 - x \sqrt{5} + 1   0.$ Then determine $r^8 + s^8.$
\\
\hline
9 & Let $f(x)   x^2 + ax + b$ be a polynomial with real coefficients such that $f(0)   0$ and $f(1)   1.$ Find the value of $a$ if the graph of $f$ intersects the line $y   x$ at $x   0.$ & 
Let $r$ and $s$ denote the two real roots of $x^2 - x \sqrt{5} + 1   0.$ Then determine $r^8 + s^8.$
\\
\hline
10 & Let $x$ and $y$ be positive real numbers. Find the maximum value of $xy^2 + xy$ if $x^2 + y^2   1.$ & 
Given that $x^2 + y^2   14x + 6y + 6,$ find the largest possible value of $3x + 4y.$
\\
\hline
\end{longtable}
title: A Neural Network Solves, Explains, and Generates University Math Problems by Program Synthesis and Few-Shot Learning at Human Level
